_header: Sic uite peniteas if heaven thou think to win
_description: On need for repentance and cleansing from sin to gain heaven — 8 couplets

OxfMagdEstate.First Lines:
Sic uite peniteas ȝif heuene thow thynk to wynneCor
                        simul inspiceas and clense the clene fram synne…
OxfMagdEstate.Last Lines:
…Synne but þu for sake sic semper corde
                    dolebisffor withe ffendes blake aliter sine fine
                    manebis
OxfMagdEstate.Editions:
O’Donoghue,  Berna,  and  Christopher Woolgar.  
             “Three Early Fifteenth-Century Poems at Magdalen College,
                Oxford.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 27 [225] (1980): 497-500.
